title: OFC Tender Summary
content:
Tender Summary

1. Tender Overview (NIT)

  • Organization: Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL), Kolkata Telecom District.

  • Work Description: Outsourcing of SLA-based Optical Fiber Cable (OFC) Route Repair & Maintenance (R&M) works.

  • Scope: Various Transmission Maintenance (TM) Divisions in Kolkata TD.

  • Bid Number: GeM Bid No. GEM/2025/B/6812565.

  • Total Quantum: 2029.69 Route Kilometers (RKM).

2. Schedule of Work and Rates (Table-A & SOR)

  • Schedules: The work is divided into 5 schedules based on estimated RKM.

  • Schedule Details:

    • Schedule 1 (South-I, South-II): 478.38 RKM | EMD: Rs. 1,12,853.

    • Schedule 2 (Central, North-I): 443.91 RKM | EMD: Rs. 1,04,721.

    • Schedule 3 (North-II, Salt Lake): 430.02 RKM | EMD: Rs. 1,01,444.

    • Schedule 4 (Howrah, Hooghly): 386.31 RKM | EMD: Rs. 91,133.

    • Schedule 5 (Panihati): 291.07 RKM | EMD: Rs. 68,665.

  • Rate: Fixed rate of Rs. 833.00 per KM per Month.

  • Total Estimated Cost (1 Year): Rs. 2,39,40,761.86 (including GST).

  • EMD/Bid Security: 2% of the Estimated Cost.

  • Quantity Variation: BSNL reserves the right to vary quantity by -25% to +25%.

RKM YEAR Formula: RKM maintained × years (e.g., 240 RKM for 3 months = 240×0.25=60 RKM YEAR).

Contract & Security Deposits

  • Contract Period: 1 year, extendable by up to 1 year.

  • Performance Security: 5% of GeM Contract value via ePBG (valid for 30 months).

  • Material Security: Rs. 2,00,000/- per schedule (valid for 18 months).

Award of Contract

  • L1 Selection: One successful bidder per schedule. L1 is the lowest evaluated price. If a tie occurs, the L1 is system-selected by GeM.

  • Document Upload Efficiency: Bidders participating in multiple schedules need only upload full eligibility documents for the highest-ranked schedule and submit a declaration for others to reference those documents.

  • Contract Issue: Separate GeM Contracts issued for each schedule.

  • Security Submission: ePBG (Performance) and Material Security BG must be submitted within 15 days of contract issue.

Scope of Work (Section-III)

  • Primary Activities:

    1. Preventive Maintenance (Patrolling).

    2. Corrective Maintenance (Fault Repair).

    3. Scheduled/Planned Maintenance.

    4. Network Improvement (Fiber retrieval, loss reduction).

    5. GPS Data Collection and Mapping.

  • Tools: FRTs must use BSNL IT Systems and Apps (e.g., "Call Before you Dig") for tracking and reporting.

Site Examination & Route Handover

  • Site Inspection: Bidders are deemed to have inspected the site, soil, and conditions before bidding.

  • Staff Deployment: Contractor must intimate details of Supervisor and Splicers immediately after acceptance.

  • Joint Survey:

    • Must be conducted to ascertain exact route length (Trench length, not OTDR length).

    • Survey Report (Annexure-B) must be submitted within 10 days of contract issue.

  • Drawings: Route Index Drawings (RID) provided once; Contractor must verify and update them during the contract.

  1. Preventive Maintenance Strategy

  • Objective: Avoid OFC cuts/damage from external agencies or natural calamities.

  • Patrolling: Regular surveillance required. Patrolling team must report daily to the Site Engineer.

  • Coordination: Contractor must liaise with NHAI, Municipalities, Railways, and other operators to track digging/excavation activities.

  • Intervention: If civic work poses a threat, the patrolling team must remain on-site and protect the OFC until the Fault Repair Team (FRT) arrives.

  • Road Expansion/Civic Works: In case of large-scale road works, the contractor must bypass sections by laying temporary overhead (OH) OFC to prevent outages. These must be recovered later.

  • Patrolling Tracking:

    • Must use the Prajwal App (Android 8.0+) for tracking movement.

    • Patrollers must carry a BSNL SIM (primary) and a standby SIM from another operator.

  • Indicators & Safety: Ensure route indicators are not stolen/damaged. Immediate correction of sagging overhead alignment.

  • Availability: Patrolling teams must be available 24/7 with two mobile connections.

  • Reporting: Submit daily reports and Management Information System (MIS) reports as per BSNL formats.

  1. Corrective Maintenance & Fault Restoration

  • Response Time: Fault Repair Team (FRT) must mobilize within 30 minutes of intimation (via SMS/App/Call).

  • Restoration Target: All systems/fibers must be restored within 4 hours.

  • Process: Includes localization, excavation, cable laying, splicing, testing, and updating Route Index Diagrams (RID).

  • Permissions: Contractor responsible for obtaining permissions from civic authorities (BSNL pays Demand Note).

  • Damages: If the contractor damages other utilities (water/power), they must repair it at their own cost.

  • Theft/Damage: Contractor must file FIR/Police complaint and submit the report to BSNL.

  • Link Budget: Contractor must show at least 10% improvement in link budget in each section.

  1. Shifting Temporary Overhead (OH) to Underground (UG)

  • Timeline & Penalties:

    1. Permission Application: Apply to civic authorities within 7 days of BSNL intimation.

      • Penalty: Rs. 200/day (Day 8-10), Rs. 500/day (>Day 10).

    2. Start of Work: Start shifting within 7 days of receiving permission.

      • Penalty: Rs. 500/day (>Day 7).

    3. Completion: Complete work within 15 days.

      • Penalty: Rs. 500/day (>Day 15).

  • Note: Penalties are over and above the SLA capping. BSNL pays nothing extra for shifting work.

  1. Scheduled Planned Maintenance

  • Objective: Bring optical section loss to < 0.3 dB/KM and splice loss to < 0.1 dB.

  • Activities: Re-splicing, cable protection, verifying indicators, earthing pit maintenance, and fiber retrieval.

  • Execution: Performed with BSNL approval, generally during 00:00 to 05:00 hours (Sat/Sun).

  1. Route Improvement (1% Patch Work)

  • Scope: Re-laying OFC (PLB pipes, pulling, splicing) up to a maximum of 1% of the estimated route length per annum (patches < 200m).

  • Material: BSNL provides PLB Pipe and OF Cable.

  • Contractor Responsibility: Transport of BSNL materials, supply of other materials (Protection pipes, Chambers, Indicators), and execution.

  • Exclusion: Does not include routine cable pulling (<100m) done for fault localization.

  1. Allied Activities & Material Handling

  • Transportation: Contractor bears the cost of transporting materials from BSNL stores to the site.

  • Empty Cable Drums:

    • Contractor must dispose of empty drums within 3 days.

    • Recovery Rate: Rs. 200.00 per drum will be deducted from the contractor’s bill.

  • Supply: Contractor supplies consumables like Bricks, Cement, Wire Mesh, etc.

  • Defective Work: If the contractor fails to execute, BSNL may get it done via an outside agency and deduct the cost.

  1. Contractor's Office & Reporting

  • Establishment: Office must be equipped (Fax, Mobile, Email, GPS) within 7 days of LOI.

  • Location: Geographically convenient for route maintenance.

  • GPS Mapping: Contractor must capture GPS coordinates (up to 7 decimal places) of joints, routes, and landmarks for GIS mapping.

  • Reports: Daily patrolling, weekly prevention, monthly stock, monthly fault (Transnet), monthly splice loss/OTDR, and updated Route Index Diagrams (RID).

  1. Manpower & Team Deployment

  • Supervisor: 1 per work, coordinates daily with BSNL.

  • Patroller: Minimum 1 per 100 KM route daily. Monitored via Prajwal App.

  • Fault Repair Team (FRT): Minimum 1 FRT per 200 KM.

    • Composition: 1 Supervisor, 1 Splicing Engineer, Minimum 2 Labors, 1 Driver with 4-wheeler vehicle.

    • Vehicle: Must have a dustproof chamber (preferably AC).

  • Equipment Cost: Contractor bears cost for JCB, HDD, GPR survey, and Topographic survey during fault restoration.

  1. Tool Kit & Testing Equipment (Per FRT)

  • Mandatory Tools: Masonry kit, 200m Nylon rope, Safety gear (Helmets, Jackets), 1 KVA Portable DG Set, Dewatering Pump, Digital Camera/Smart phone with App, Barricading tape.

  • Testing Gear:

    • OTDR (1 No.)

    • Power Meter (-40db to +20dbm) & Source.

    • Splicing Machine (TSEC/TEC spec).

    • Optical Fiber Tool Kit (Cleaver, Stripper, etc.).

    • Duct Rodder (300m) & GPS Tool.

  1. Material Management

  • Imprest Stock: BSNL issues critical materials to be stocked by Contractor (Imprest limit per FRT includes 2KM OFC, 1KM PLB pipe, 10 Joint Closures, etc.).

  • Stock Level: Contractor must maintain at least 50% stock and request replenishment.

  • Shortage: If BSNL cannot supply minor items (pigtails, patch cords), Contractor supplies them and is reimbursed at previous year's procurement rates.

  1. Service Level Agreement (SLA) Parameters

  • Corrective Maintenance:

    • Faults: Maximum 1 OFC Cut / 100 Kms / Month.

    • Splice Loss: <= 0.1 dB per fiber.

    • Mean Time to Repair (MTTR): < 4 Hours per OFC cut.

  • Preventive Maintenance:

    • Patrolling: 100 KM per day per patroller (365 days/year).

  • App Usage: Mandatory use of Prajwal App for tracking FRT and Patrollers.

  1. SLA Relaxations & Defect Repair

  • Delay Waivers: MTTR delay may be deducted for Water clogging, Rat cutting, Single fiber fault, Local disputes, or Natural calamity (subject to DGM approval).

  • Failure to Execute: If the contractor fails to repair defects, BSNL may hire an outside agency and deduct the cost from the contractor.

1. Penalty Clauses on SLA Parameters

  • Fault Rate: > 1 fault per 100 km/month → Rs. 1000 for each additional fault.

  • Splice Loss: > 0.1 dB per fiber → Rs. 500 per joint per occasion (Contractor must redo at own cost).

  • MTTR (Mean Time To Repair):

    • Up to 4 hrs: Nil.

    • 4 to 6 hrs: Rs. 500.

    • 6 to 24 hrs: Rs. 500 + Rs. 100 per hour beyond 6 hrs.

    24 hrs: Rs. 5000.

  • Patrolling: Absence or coverage < 100 km/day → Rs. 1000 per day.

  • Penalty Cap: Maximum 25% of monthly bill. Successive 25% penalties for 3 months may lead to contract cancellation.

2. Additional Penalties

  • Manpower Default:

    • Absence of Supervisor: Rs. 10,000 per month.

    • Absence of FRT: Rs. 5,000 per day per FRT.

  • Network Improvement: Failure to complete 1% re-laying work within 45 days → Rs. 2 Lakh per km (over and above SLA cap).

  • Jointing: Bad workmanship/Cross fiber → Rs. 2,500 per joint.

  • Public Inconvenience: Trench > 200m open > 1 day → Rs. 300 per day.

  • Damage to BSNL Cables:

    • OFC Cut (Any size): Rs. 1,50,000 per occasion.

    • Copper Cable: Variable penalty based on size (e.g., 5 pair = Rs. 7,500 + Rs. 4,500/slab).

    • Contractor must also repair the damage free of cost.

  • Third-Party Damage: Contractor liable for claims/penalties from other agencies (utilities/public property).

Jurisdiction

  • Nodal Officers: Designated Divisional Engineers (DE/TM) for each division act as Nodal Officers.

Award & Execution of Work

  • Work Order (WO): Issued by Nodal Officer based on PGM TX authorization.

  • ROW/Permissions: Contractor must obtain permissions from civic authorities (Police/Municipal). BSNL pays ROW charges.

  • Quantum Variation: BSNL reserves the right to vary work by -25% to +25% without rate change. Contractor may be asked to do additional 50% work.

  • Operational Flexibility: Contractor may be asked to work in any other Division/Sub-Region in exigencies.

Billing & Payment Terms

  • Platform: Invoices must be processed via the BSNL VIPA (Vendor Invoice Processing Automation) platform.

  • Submission: Monthly consolidated bills to be submitted within 10 days of month completion to the Centralized Claim Cell (Kolkata).

  • Required Documents:

    • Daily/Weekly/Monthly reports (Patrolling, Faults, Stock, Splice Loss).

    • Updated Route Index Diagram (RID) with GPS coordinates.

    • GST returns copy.

  • Certification: Nodal Officer certifies bills and checks against SLA performance/penalties.

VIPA (Vendor Invoice Processing Automation) Platform

  • Registration: Contractor must register on the VIPA platform by sending approved email ID and mobile number on company letterhead to bsnlvipahelp@gmail.com.

  • Facilitation Charges: Charges recovered per invoice for processing on VIPA (w.e.f. 01-07-2025):

    • Invoice Value up to Rs. 1,00,000/-: NIL.

    • From Rs. 1,00,001/- to Rs. 5,00,000/-: Rs. 590/-.

    • From Rs. 5,00,001/- to Rs. 50,00,000/-: Rs. 1,180/-.

    • Exceeding Rs. 50,00,000/-: Rs. 2,360/-.

  • Submission Process:

    • Digital invoice (PDF) must be emailed to bsnlvipa@eyipa.com and bsnlvipa@bsnl.co.in.

    • Email must contain three attachments: Invoice, SCC/POD, and PO support documents (compressed ZIP).

    • Total file size must not exceed 30MB.

Warranty

  • Scope: Material supplied must be new, free from defects, and meet specifications.

  • Liability: Contractor responsible for defects arising from faulty materials/design (e.g., corrosion) and must remedy them at their own cost.

General Commercial Conditions

  • Prices: Fixed for the contract period; includes levies/insurance (excludes GST). No variation allowed.

  • Subcontracts: Strictly prohibited.

  • Rescission/Termination:

    • Triggers: Breach of contract, damage to BSNL property, statutory notices, abandonment of work, or incurring maximum penalties for 3 consecutive months.

    • Consequences: Forfeiture of security deposit. Unexecuted work completed by BSNL/another agency at the risk and cost of the defaulting contractor.

  • Insolvency: Contract terminates without compensation if the contractor becomes bankrupt.

  • Optional Termination: BSNL may terminate at any time (non-default) with notice; contractor paid for work done up to that point.

Exit Clause

  • By Partner (Contractor): Must give 90 days advance written notice, but only after completion of one year.

  • By BSNL: Must give 30 days advance written notice.

  • PBG Forfeiture:

    • If Partner gives advance notice but BSNL has already served termination notice, PBG is forfeited.

    • If Partner gives notice without prior BSNL termination notice, PBG is not forfeited.

Indemnities

  • Scope: Contractor indemnifies BSNL against all suits, damages, costs, and claims from third parties or employees.

  • Labour Laws: Contractor is solely responsible for compliance with EPF, ESI, Minimum Wages Act, Workmen's Compensation Act, etc. BSNL is not liable for any personnel claims.

Force Majeure

  • Events: War, hostility, civil commotion, fire, flood, epidemic, strikes, Act of God.

  • Notification: Must be given within 21 days of occurrence.

  • Termination: If performance is delayed by force majeure for more than 60 days, either party may terminate the contract.

Legal Jurisdiction & Set Off

  • Applicable Law: Indian Law (Substantive and Procedural).

  • Jurisdiction: Courts at Kolkata only.

  • Set Off (Clause 12): BSNL reserves the right to appropriate any money due to the contractor (including Security Deposit/bills) to settle claims against the contractor.

Defaults and Banning Actions (Appendix-1)

  • Submitting Fake/Forged Documents (Bank Instruments/Experience/Turnover):

    • Action: Rejection of bid, Banning for 3 years, Termination of PO/WO, Forfeiture of EMD/SD/PG.

  • Violent/Coercive Means (Obstructing Tender Process):

    • Action: Banning for 3 years.

  • Non-receipt of Acceptance (APO/SD/PG):

    • Action: Forfeiture of EMD.

  • Failure to Supply/Execute Work:

    • Action: Termination of PO/WO, Execution of work at Risk & Cost of defaulting vendor, Recovery of excess charges.

  • Major Quality Problems/Unsatisfactory Performance:

    • Action: Return of material, Recovery of cost, or Financial Penalty determined by committee. Withdrawal of TSEC/IA.

  • Submission of Fraudulent Claims (Excess Quantity/Rates):

    • Action: Recovery of overpayment, Banning for 3 years.

  • Network Security/Privacy Breach (Tampering/Hacking):

    • Action: Termination, Banning for 3 years, Recovery of loss, Legal action.

  • Insolvency/Bankruptcy:

    • Action: Termination, Settlement of bills for quantity already received/usable.

Performance Guarantee (PG) Forfeiture in Default

  • If a vendor defaults (e.g., submits fake docs after PO issue), the PG/SD is forfeited. If PG/SD is not yet released, EMD is returned only after realization of PG/SD.

  • Network Security/Privacy Breach: If the vendor hacks accounts, disrupts networks, or tampers with hardware/software, actions include termination, banning for 3 years, and legal action.

  • Insolvency/Bankruptcy: If the vendor becomes bankrupt/insolvent, the contract is terminated. Bills are settled only for usable material already received.

  • Conviction (Moral Turpitude): If the proprietor/partner is convicted by a Court of Law, actions include termination and banning for 3 years.

  • Non-return of Dues: If the vendor refuses to return BSNL dues, arbitration or legal recovery suits will be initiated.

Special Conditions of Contract (Section-V)

  • Work Execution: Work is accepted only after successful testing by the BSNL team.

  • Time Extension: Contractor must apply for extension within 3 days of any hindrance. Decision of DGM is final.

  • Recovery: BSNL can appropriate Security Deposit or running bills to recover dues.

  • Retired Officials: No Gazetted officer can work as a contractor within 2 years of retirement without Govt. permission. Violation leads to contract cancellation.

  • Insolvency/Death: CGM Kolkata TD has the power to terminate the contract without compensation in case of contractor's insolvency or death (though heirs may be permitted to continue at discretion).

Stores Supplied by BSNL

  • Limit: Value of stores issued shall not exceed the Material Security Deposit.

  • Transportation: Contractor must transport stores from BSNL Store to the work site at their own cost.

  • Ownership: Materials remain BSNL property. Unused material must be returned upon completion/termination.

  • Discrepancy Penalty: Any discrepancy/loss of material will be charged to the contractor at 1.5 times the prevailing standard price (including freight/handling).

Material Management & Accounting

  • Logistics: Contractor is responsible for transportation, storage, and safe custody of materials issued by BSNL.

  • Accounting: A proper account of materials must be submitted monthly.

  • Penalties: Discrepancies or loss of material will be charged to the contractor at 1.5 times the prevailing standard price (including freight/handling).

  • Return: Recovered materials (OFC, joints) and unused stores must be returned to BSNL in good condition.

Easements, Permits & ROW

  • Responsibility: Contractor must pursue and obtain permissions (ROW) from road/forest/civic authorities.

  • Charges: BSNL pays the ROW charges/demand notes; Contractor is not paid extra for liaison work.

  • Drawings: Contractor prepares requisition drawings for permissions.

Protection of Life, Property & Safety

  • Safety Measures: Mandatory use of warning boards (min size 3’ x 2’), traffic signals, barricades, and flags.

  • Penalty: Rs. 500/- per day if warning signals are not installed.

  • Utility Damage: Contractor is solely liable for damages to existing underground utilities (water, power, gas). BSNL does not provide diagrams of existing utilities.

  • Crossings: Strict adherence to rules for railway/highway crossings.

Labour Welfare & Regulations

  • License: Valid Labour License under Contract Labour (R&A) Act 1970 required before commencement.

  • Wages: Compliance with Minimum Wages Act and working hours. Notices must be displayed at the site.

  • Registers: Contractor must maintain the following registers:

    • Persons Employed (Form XIII), Muster Roll (Form XVI), Wages (Form XVII).

    • Accidents, Fines (Form XII), Deductions (Form XX), Advances (Form MMIII), Overtime (Form XXIII).

  • Cards/Certificates: Issue Employment Card (Form XIV) within 3 days and Service Certificate (Form XV) upon termination.

  • Record Retention: Labour records must be preserved for 3 years.

Insurance

  • Requirement: Contractor must take comprehensive insurance at their own cost covering:

    • Third-party risk.

    • Plant, machinery, and materials.

    • Workmen’s compensation.

  • Submission: Original policies must be submitted to BSNL within 15 days of demand.

Tools, Plants & Site Execution Instructions

  • Resources: Contractor provides all tools, dewatering pumps, and water for curing concrete.

  • Barricading Penalty: If contractor fails to provide barricades/cones:

    • 5% additional penalty levied.

    • If BSNL supplies them, 150% of the cost is recovered from the contractor.

  • Work Timing: Municipal permissions typically allow work only at night (10 PM to 6 AM). No delay excuses accepted on this ground.

  • Road Restoration: Cut portions of BT/Concrete roads must be restored immediately.

  • Non-Performance:

    • If work is abandoned or restricted due to non-performance, the contractor is banned for 6 months from similar work in Kolkata TD.

    • BSNL reserves the right to disqualify bidders with a record of past contract failures.

Site Restoration & Work Variation

  • Road Restoration: Contractor must restore cut portions of BT/Concrete roads immediately after pipe laying. Unsatisfactory restoration costs will be recovered from the contractor.

  • Workload: Simultaneous work in multiple sections does not absolve the contractor of timely completion.

  • Quantity Variation: BSNL may increase or decrease the estimated work by 25% at approved rates.

OFC Splicing Specifications

  • Joint Pit: Size approx. 1.2m length. Sufficient cable length must be coiled on the pit wall for future repairs.

  • Cable Preparation:

    • Stripping: Outer/inner sheath stripped staggered by 10mm.

    • Cleaning: Fibers cleaned with isopropyl alcohol.

    • Cleaving: 90-degree face required.

  • Fusion Splicing:

    • Uses automatic microprocessor-controlled machine.

    • Splice Loss Limit: < 0.05 dB per splice (verified via OTDR and Power Meter).

    • Protection: Heat shrink sleeves used.

  • Organizing: Fibers coiled in trays to avoid micro-bending.

  • Closure Sealing: Pit closed only after satisfactory splice loss confirmation.

Route & Joint Indicators

  • Location: Placed at every manhole/joint chamber (1m towards jungle side) and road crossings.

  • Construction:

    • Pit size: 60 cm x 60 cm x 75 cm (depth).

    • fixing: Secured by ramming stones/murum (60 cm) and Concreting (15 cm, Ratio 1:2:4).

  • Painting/Marking:

    • Route Indicators: Painted Yellow.

    • Joint Indicators: Painted Red.

    • Sign Writing: Route/Joint number (e.g., 2/6 = 6th indicator after 2nd joint).

OFC Laying Specifications

  • Trench Depth:

    • Standard: 165 cm.

    • Rocky Terrain: 100 to 140 cm (restricted).

    • Slope: < 15 degrees.

    • Width: 45 cm (top) / 30 cm (bottom).

  • Process:

    1. Excavation.

    2. Laying PLB pipes/coils.

    3. Mechanical protection (RCC/GI pipes) where required.

    4. Backfilling and dressing.

    5. Cable Pulling: Manholes opened, 6mm PP rope replaced with 8mm, cable pulled, manholes sealed.

Horizontal Directional Drilling (HDD)

  • Usage: For urban areas or obstacles (roads, rivers, railways) to avoid surface disturbance.

  • Process: Pilot bore -> Back reamer -> Product pulling.

  • Steering: Drill bit face orientation controls direction (e.g., 12 o'clock = rise, 6 o'clock = deep).

  • Tracking: Transmitter in drill head sends signals to aboveground receiver.

Joint Chamber Construction

  • Brick Chamber Specs:

    • Pit Size: 2m x 2m x 1.8m.

    • Base Concrete: 1.7m x 1.7m x 0.15m (Mix 1:5:10).

    • Internal Dimensions: 1m x 1m x 1m.

    • Wall: 9” x 4.5” x 3” bricks.

    • Plastering: 12mm thick (Cement mortar 1:3).

    • Pipe Entry: PLB pipes must protrude min 5 cm inside.

Joint Chamber Covers

  • Material: Pre-cast RCC slabs reinforced with steel wire fabric (75 x 25 mm mesh).

  • Dimensions: Size 0.7 m x 1.4 m, Thickness 5 cm.

  • Quantity: Two slabs required per joint chamber.

  • Finishing: Joint chamber filled with clean sand and backfilled with excavated soil.

Earthing of Armoured Cable

  • Requirement: Splice points must be earthed to protect against lightning/induced currents.

  • Exception: Earthing is prohibited in EPR (Earth Potential Raise) zones.

  • Standard: Maximum earth resistance < 5 Ohms.

  • Splice Closures: Metallic components (armour) are electrically paralleled and connected to a spike earth via a lead wire.

  • Exchange Termination (FTB):

    • Armoured cable terminated in Fibre Termination Box (FTB).

    • FTB earth must be separate from Equipment Earth and Electrical Earth.

    • Uses insulated multi-strand earth wire (preferably green).

  • Maintenance:

    • Check connections: Every 3 months.

    • Measure resistance: Once a year (record date/value in register).

    • Watering: As necessary in dry seasons.

Spike Earth Installation Specifications

  • Design: Earth electrode system using one or more GI pipes.

    • Pipe Specs: 25.0 mm or 38.0 mm dia; Length 275 cm or 375 cm.

    • Spacing: Minimum 250 cm between spikes.

  • Installation Process:

    • Trench dug 70 to 100 cm deep.

    • Spikes driven vertically using a sledgehammer or sliding hammer.

    • Connection: Spikes connected by a main earth conductor (bare tinned copper protected by PVC pipe).

  • Enhancement: If < 5Ω is not achieved, use Charcoal/Salt/Sand mixture or Calcium Bentonite/Gypsum compound.

  • Marking: Electrode positions marked on the splice chamber for identification and watering.

Schedule of Rates (SOR) - Section XIII-A

  • Work Description: R&M: Preventive Maintenance (including patrolling) and Corrective maintenance of OFC routes for all soil types/strata.

  • Unit of Measurement: Per KM per Month.

  • Fixed Rate: Rs. 833.00/- (Exclusive of GST).

  • Terms:

    • BSNL supplies PLB/HDPE/GI/RCC/DWC pipes, OF Cable, Joint Closures, and Couplers.

    • Contractor transports stores from BSNL store to the site at their own cost.

    • Contractor lays DWC split/RCC split/stone slabs for protection as per SDE's direction.

    • Rates are inclusive of all levies (except GST).

Corrective Maintenance Reporting Formats (Annexure-A)

  • Fault Report: Captures Fault Date/Time, Location (Distance from station), Restoration Time, Duration, and Joint details (Cable laid, Chamber status).

  • Transnet Update: Confirmation of updating joint GPS coordinates in the Transnet system.

  • Fiber Status: Records Optical Length and Loss (dB) for all fibers post-rectification.

  • Certification: Contractor certifies satisfactory splice loss (<0.1 dB), erection of indicators, and no damage to external utilities.

Preventive Maintenance Reporting Formats (Annexure-A)

  • Daily Patrolling Report:

    • Checklist: Monitors digging, flooding, new construction, farming activity, and status of markers/chambers.

    • Action Taken: Records preventive steps for observed hazards.

    • Tracking: Logs Location (Landmarks), Entry/Exit times, and liaison details with local authorities.

  • Monthly Attendance Sheet: Daily log (Days 1-31) of Patroller's timings (In/Out), Route covered, Observations, and reporting time. Verified by BSNL Route In-charge.

Maintenance Reporting Formats (Annexure-A continued)

  • Restoration Report:

    • Consolidated: Monthly tracking of total faults, permanent fixes made, temporary fixes made, and pending permanent restorations.

    • Details: Logs fault location (From-To, Km ref), date of occurrence, and specific details of temporary/permanent repairs.

  • Stock/Stores Report: Monthly reconciliation of materials received from BSNL, consumed, and balance.

    • Items Tracked: OF Cable (96F/48F/24F), Joint Closures, PLB Duct, Patch Cards, Attenuators.

  • FRT Work Diary:

    • Submitted with monthly invoices.

    • Logs Docket No., Route Name, Date/Time of Fault & Restoration, Reason, and Material Used (OFC/SJC) for every fault attended.

Route Taking Over Format (Annexure-B)

  • Purpose: Official documentation for handing over routes to the contractor.

  • Data Fields:

    • Trans Net ID and Route Name.

    • Route Length.

    • Type of OFC (6F/12F/24F/48F/96F/288F).

    • OTDR readings for each fiber.

    • Physical Status: Breakdown of Overhead fiber Km vs. Underground fiber Km.

  • Validation: Requires joint signatures by the Vendor and Transmission Maintenance (TM) officer.

List of Outsourced Routes (Annexure-J)

  • Schedule 1: TM/South-I and TM/South-II:

    • FRT Team: FRT-1/Behala (Nodal Officer: DE/TM/South-I).
